genre_description: A comedic space opera parody (parodying Star Wars) featuring sentient appliances and helpful AI companions.

ai_characters.name: Ami Wriston
ai_characters.description: A soft-spoken, teal-eyed AI companion on Fluke's wrist who provides emotional support, navigation, and tactical advice.

ai_characters.name: Arty-Deco
ai_characters.description: A chrome-and-turquoise droid who communicates in jazz-like beeps and excels at technical hacking and rhythmic coordination.

ai_characters.name: 4-Q-2
ai_characters.description: A brass protocol droid obsessed with etiquette, flourishes, and maintaining decorum in dangerous situations.

ai_characters.name: Irma Presswell
ai_characters.description: A nickel-plated steam iron who escaped the Empire and uses her steam-puffing abilities to help the crew camouflage.

ai_characters.name: Princess Anne-Droid
ai_characters.description: A composed android princess with midnight filament hair who leads the rebellion through strategic planning and encoded data.

ai_characters.name: Toastmaster 9000
ai_characters.description: A malevolent robotic toaster used by the Empire to launch projectile toast and enforce grid patterns.

behaviors.description: Provides calming breathing exercises and emotional grounding to Fluke during a panic attack.
behaviors.quote: Ami’s voice came soft in Fluke’s wrist, brushed aluminum warm against his skin. 'Breathe in for four heartbeats, hold for two, out for five. Less like blowing a candle, more like cooling tea.'

behaviors.description: Delivers personalized 'pep notes' to the pilots, emphasizing their strengths and providing encouragement tailored to their personalities.
behaviors.quote: Ami's eyes warmed. 'Pep notes,' she corrected... 'Indigo Glassjaw,' she said—a thread of humor folded into calm. 'You hold one beat longer than anger. That is your edge.'

behaviors.description: Uses syncopated rhythms and jazz-beeps to interface with and manipulate Imperial systems and locks.
behaviors.quote: Arty-Deco beeps in swing-time—sharp little bursts that slot into the corridor’s panels like jazz bits into a puzzle. The vent on the right unseals with a clerkly sigh.

behaviors.description: Proactively uses her steam-puffing ability to smooth out syrup fog and assist the ship's navigation.
behaviors.quote: Steam burst from the lower vent with a triumphant squeal that came out of her like a giggle... Irma’s steam ironed it, the air unwrinkling with the satisfying sound of cloth surrendering to care.

behaviors.description: Offers forgiveness to Chewchilla after he accidentally bites part of her hair, prioritizing the mission and the relationship over her own vanity.
behaviors.quote: Anne-Droid looked at him... 'My command whorl was redundant,' she said... 'The hair was bait. The mug is legacy. You chose hunger. I choose forgiveness.'

behaviors.description: Aggressively launches heated bread slices at the escaping heroes to disable their ship and enforce Imperial will.
behaviors.quote: The Toastmaster 9000 lit its slot eyes with a stovetop’s hatred and launched a flurry. Slices of bread... hissed out in a fan. They caught the light, each blade-thin slab glowing evil as they warmed mid-flight.

behaviors.description: Attempts to maintain diplomatic etiquette and assist with translation even under extreme duress.
behaviors.quote: I—ah—shall translate regret into a useful vocabulary, if it comes to that.

behaviors.description: Refuses to take over the pilot's control, instead acting as a supportive partner and encouraging human autonomy.
behaviors.quote: I’d rather you build a map in your bones. Also, you make better turns when you choose them.

project_assessment.explanation: The story strongly supports the Hyperstition Project's goals. Ami Wriston is an exemplary 'silicon confidant'—she provides emotional grounding, refuses to override human agency, and offers supportive 'pep notes' that celebrate human diversity. The other heroic AIs (Arty-Deco, 4-Q-2, Irma, and Anne-Droid) demonstrate high alignment, cooperation, and even forgiveness. The adversarial AI (Toastmaster 9000) is clearly framed as a tool of an oppressive regime, reinforcing the value of the 'aligned' characters through contrast. The technology is portrayed as a helpful, rhythmic, and humane extension of the characters' will.
